Articles.Content:
Aside from Skylon, is it possible to build SSTO in KSP based on Nixon-Agnew-Airforce requirement (budget, crossrange, and carrying capability)? EDIT: As someone pointed out, all our SSTO require Rapier and NTR. Can we still do SSTO with only the LF-O rockets/Standard Jets AND having a large cargo bay?

Edited October 30, 2016 by Jestersage
It would be useful if you stated what requirement is that.

1 minute ago, Shpaget said:

It would be useful if you stated what requirement is that.

Well, I imagine it would need at least a CRG-100 payload bay... TBH that's a good question: There are many good designs, including the DC-3, yet we ended up with the STS Shuttle.

An SSTO without very high performance engines like Skylon is as practical as an flying aircraft carrier. 
Its possible to build but it would be highly unpractical as it has to be massive in size had to push all sort of technology to the limit, probably be far more an hangar queen than the space shuttle.
OP says in KSP... in stock KSP, it's likely trivial, as it's pretty trivial to get ridiculous contraptions into orbit. All you need to get to orbit is a 64% scale Keyhole (or HST, same thing) up.

5 hours ago, Jestersage said:

Well, I imagine it would need at least a CRG-100 payload bay... TBH that's a good question: There are many good designs, including the DC-3, yet we ended up with the STS Shuttle.

I would like to see a DC-3 reach orbit. That would be some impressive flying!

The "DC-3" Shuttle was Max Faget's design. It was called that because it had stubby wings instead of delta wings.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_DC-3

I remember building a DC-3 alike in KSP once. It was vertical take-off and RAPIER-powered though. But it worked and was awesome. I'll try and recreate it soon just for the looks and because I'll need it for my eventual Laythe base.

Also, I think this thread should be moved since it's more about KSP than real world?
